content:
First, i'm so happy to be here. I love everything about rust and the direction where it's going. I want to rewrite my web shop in rust and since yesterday i'm stuck trying to change the size of the html canvas element generated from my rust code. Still trying to figure out the doc at docs.rs. But right now i really want to move on so if anybody can help me... it would be a bliss.

I'll update it myself, but if you have a reply and want to share it there : https://stackoverflow.com/questions/71818195/rust-webassembly-inside-browser-change-html-canvas-size-eframe/71820106#71820106

If you want the intrinsic size of the canvas to determine its size you can remove the height/width properties from the style="..." attribute

If you do want to be able to adjust the size in CSS and the intrinsic size separately though you'd do it through the style getter - https://docs.rs/web-sys/latest/web_sys/struct.HtmlCanvasElement.html#method.style

then either https://docs.rs/web-sys/latest/web_sys/struct.CssStyleDeclaration.html#method.set_property or https://docs.rs/web-sys/latest/web_sys/struct.CssStyleDeclaration.html#method.set_css_text

Thanks man !! (I'm still trying to figure it out so i'll leave the thread open for now just in case)
Thanks a lot for that <3
